Incident.Summary: Wicomico County Narcotics investigation conducted by Det. Swafford involving the seizure of a parcel, believed to contain CDS, that was shipped to 29100 Santa Fe Drive, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland.

IncidentSuppNarrative.NarrativeText:
WCN investigation conducted by Det. Swafford, involving a parcel containing CDS set to be delivered to 29100 Santa Fe Drive, Salisbury, Maryland.  

Caes open pending further investigation.

On April 30, 2023, Detective Brian Swafford #0430 and members of the Wicomico Narcotics unit were alerted by Metro Area Drug Task Force hereinafter referred to as MADTF, to a parcel by that was scheduled to arrive at the UPS facility located at 2236 Northwood Drive, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland 21801 on May 1, 2023. The parcel was reported to weigh 5 pounds and was suspected of containing Controlled Dangerous Substances. The parcel shipping label bears United Parcel Service tracking number:1Z972FR10127580225, and is addressed to Antonio Johnson, 29100 Santa Fe Drive, Salisbury, MD 21801. The return address on the package is identified as, Shipper: Mailbox & Postal, 6268366675, 80 W Sierra Madre Blvd, Sierra Madre, CA 91024 United States of America.

    On May 1, 2023, the parcel arrived at the UPS facility located at 2236 Northwood Drive, Salisbury, Wicomico County, Maryland 2180. On May 1, 2023, at approximately 0710 hours, the aforementioned parcel was removed from the belt by MADTF investigators and a K9 scan requested. The parcel was scanned by Corporal Culver of the Fruitland Police Department and his K9 partner Ekk. The result of the scan produced a positive response on the parcel for the odor of a controlled dangerous substance. Following the positive alert by K-9 Ekk, indicating the odor of a controlled dangerous substance (CDS), MADTF investigator, Jeff Deibel #5552, seized and transported the aforementioned parcel to the Wicomico Narcotics Office pending the issuance of a search and seizure warrant. Corporal Culver has been a Certified Police Officer for over five years, and for four of those five years has been a K9 handler. During those four years Corporal Culver trained two CDS detection K9’s. Currently, Corporal Culver is the handler of K9 Ekk. K9 Ekk is a certified police K9 who is trained in the odor of Cocaine, Heroin, Methamphetamine and MDMA (Ecstasy). Corporal Culver and K9 Ekk are a certified CDS Detection team. A Search and Seizure Warrant (SSW) was authored by Swafford and was signed by the Honorable Matthew A. Maciarello, Judge of the Circuit Court for Wicomico County at 0758 hours. On May 1, 2023, at 0805 hours, investigators executed the Search and Seizure Warrant, in accordance with the parameters set forth in the warrant. Upon opening the parcel, Swafford located a black vacuum sealed bag which contained (2) clear plastic bags containing bulk Marijuana, a Schedule I Controlled Dangerous Substance. The (2) clear bags of bulk Marijuana were weighed and were found to have a combined weight of 922.6 grams. The Marijuana was repackaged according to Maryland State Police procedure and was transported to Barrack “E” to be stored pending destruction. The Search and Seizure Warrant Return and Inventory were returned to Judge Maciarello and received with Judge Maciarello’s endorsement.  

Case Closed.
